ISSUE.TITLE: Javascript localizes value and changes the input value
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: nopCommerce version: 4.70.4 Steps to reproduce the problem: 1. Go to a Category (backend) 2. Scroll to the Product mappings 3. Change the Display order to -9876 4. Save the changes Now you can see the display order is just 0. In the picture you can see that the value in the payload gets localized with a comma: ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/24a4b316-32fc-4853-834a-2d545b9944f6) This happens in Presentation\Nop.Web\Areas\Admin\Views\Shared\Table.cshtml in line 280 in the function updateRowData_@(tableName)(currentCells, data, nameData): ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e5010c92-fc20-4864-9a8d-7cf16049f7e9) You can only save displayorders "up" to -999, because on -1000 it adds a comma, changes it to -1.0 and somehow the display order gets set to 0.
